snippet: The strong turnout among black voters for Barack Obama in 2008 helped turn the state blue for the first time in decades.
abstract: Enthusiasm for Pres Obama may be dwindling among some North Carolina black voters, demographic whose record turnout in 2008 allowed Democrats to carry the state for the first time in decades; advisers say their importance in this election cannot be overstated.

byline.contributor: Shayla Harris contributed reporting from Asheville, N.C.

lead_paragraph: The strong turnout among black voters for Barack Obama in 2008 helped turn the state blue for the first time in decades.

headline.seo: Uncertainties in Obama’s North Carolina Black Support
headline.main: Obama Looks to Rally Blacks in North Carolina
headline.print_headline: Less Zeal for Obama In a Vital Group of Voters
